p: Changes in population size, tourism, and the level of sewage treatment were translated into changes in waste water discharges and nutrient loads from point sources (Table 6). Changes in agricultural practices implied solely changes in the use of mineral and organic fertilizers. In the specific case of Mar Menor, the irrigation zone of Campo de Cartagena was reduced/increased according to the assumed relative changes by excluding/adding areas furthest away from/closest to the main irrigation channel. Furthermore, in the catchment of the Tyligulskyi Liman the effective volume of existing ponds was reduced for the two scenarios seeking environmental benefits (MH and SET). In the two other cases no specific management changes were made.
